item.title: By: Hans-Peter Kuessner
item.dc:creator: Hans-Peter Kuessner
item.description: <p>Hi Matt,</p><p>there seem to be some other gotcha - if you collapse all using this method, when having paged down to a page which does not exist when everything has been collapsed, you end with an empty view (which confuses the users, or at least me).</p><p>So my collapse all button has an additional "gotoFirstPage()" to avoid this behaviour:</p><p><code><br/>var viewPanel:com.ibm.xsp.component.xp.XspViewPanel = getComponent("viewPanel1");<br/>try {<br/> viewPanel.gotoFirstPage(); // jump to the start, as we might be on a page which won't exist when everything is collapsed<br/>} catch (e) {<br/> // if this is not possible (i. e. there is only one page), just ignore this<br/>}<br/>var model = viewPanel.getDataModel();<br/>model.getDominoViewDataContainer().collapseAll();<br/></code></p><p>Hans-Peter</p>
item.content:encoded:
Hi Matt,

there seem to be some other gotcha – if you collapse all using this method, when having paged down to a page which does not exist when everything has been collapsed, you end with an empty view (which confuses the users, or at least me).

So my collapse all button has an additional "gotoFirstPage()" to avoid this behaviour:


var viewPanel:com.ibm.xsp.component.xp.XspViewPanel = getComponent("viewPanel1");
try {
viewPanel.gotoFirstPage(); // jump to the start, as we might be on a page which won't exist when everything is collapsed
} catch (e) {
// if this is not possible (i. e. there is only one page), just ignore this
}
var model = viewPanel.getDataModel();
model.getDominoViewDataContainer().collapseAll();

Hans-Peter
